alert.note: Alert for Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:54PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Judith Basin, western Fergus and southeastern Chouteau Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 654 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Geraldine to 7 miles northeast of Geyser to 7 miles southwest of Denton to near Moore. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Geraldine, Denton, Hobson, Winifred, Moore, Fergus, Moccasin, Glengarry, Danvers, Coffee Creek, Suffolk, Square Butte, Judith Landing, Hilger, Christina, Iliad and Benchland. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 50 and 86. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 2, and between mile markers 1 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and north central Montana.
